data.event: Once a thriving 19th-century community, little remains today of Mount Carmel but a museum located within a historic home.

event.title: was established near Mount Carmel in 1817

data.event: Zion Methodist Church was established near Mount Carmel in 1817.
John Ragan, a Revolutionary soldier from Virginia, laid out the town in 1819, in what was then Covington County.
Mount Carmel incorporated in 1835, and had two or three stores, and two churches.
The town also had a well-regarded co-educational school, Mount Carmel Academy, which opened prior to 1830.

Benjamin L.C. Wailes traveled through the community in 1852 and wrote in his journal: After crossing [the] Bouie over a bridge (passing through the bottom land in which there is a good deal of large oak & gum mixed with some Shortleaf pine) ascended a considerable eminence to a level table land of Oak and hickory, on which the village of Mount Carmel is situated.
